body: LEAD: To the Editor: To the Editor: In order to set the record straight that there is more to New York City than Manhattan, I offer the following: Districts 1 and 2 in Manhattan have, respectively, 850 and 1,100 homeless pupils in hotels. These children are scattered among the schools in the district (news story, Nov. 12). District 15 in Brooklyn
title: How a Brooklyn School Copes With Crowding

body: LEAD: Friday SUMMERGARDEN FINALE Summergarden, the Museum of Modern Art's free outdoor concert series presented amid works by some of this century's greatest sculptors, ends its 12th summer season this weekend with performances tonight and tomorrow at 7:30. body: LEAD: Friday PILAR RIOJA DANCES Friday PILAR RIOJA DANCES Pilar Rioja, renowned for her remarkable repertory of Spanish dance, begins a 15-day engagement tonight at the Repertorio Espanol's Gramercy Arts Theater, at 138 East 27th Street. Miss Rioja - who is considered one of the foremost performers of Spanish flamenco, classical, court and folk
title: GOING OUT GUIDE

body: LEAD: The New York City Board of Estimate is scheduled to vote at today's meeting on new zoning rules aimed at spurring construction of lower and bulkier apartment buildings throughout the city to meet the demand for middle-income housing. title: Vote Planned On New Rules For Low Units

body: LEAD: Folk Art Institute Workshops Folk Art Institute Workshops Museum of American Folk Art, 444 Park Avenue South (30th Street); 212-481-3080. Registration is under way for day and evening classes and workshops that will begin Sept. 8. Four new courses will be offered, including a workshop that will examine the care, conservation and restoration
